data.title: Highway maintenance
data.meta_description: Find out how Alberta highways are kept safe for drivers throughout the year.
data.text:
Overview

The Government of Alberta (GoA) is responsible for maintaining highways to a safe standard. Highway maintenance services are provided by businesses throughout the province that are contracted by the GoA.

In the winter, nearly 700 snowplows and other snow removal equipment help make the more than 31,400 km of Alberta highways clear and safe for drivers.

Contract maintenance areas

Contractors provide highway maintenance operations in 25 contract maintenance areas (CMAs) of the province, the Deerfoot Trail in Calgary, and the ring roads around Calgary and Edmonton.

Find the highway maintenance contract area for your community.

Highway maintenance contractors

Contractors are responsible for highway maintenance activities including:

highway patrolling and emergency duties

winter maintenance

line painting and pavement markings

vegetation control

asphalt maintenance

gravel surface maintenance

roadside maintenance

bridge maintenance and cleaning

highway lighting and signals maintenance

Highway maintenance contractors

Contact the contractor in your area for information about highway maintenance work or the applicable District Office.

Contact

For more information, contact the District Office in your community. Check the Transportation Region and District Offices map to find the nearest office.
